io.github.daveho.funwithsound

Class Composer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.daveho.funwithsound.Composer

  • public class Composer
extends java.lang.Object
    The composer class builds upon the model classes to provide a simple domain-specific language for defining compositions consisting Rhythm and Melody objects rendered using Instrument. Note that the tempo must be set before other methods are called. Use {tempo(int, int)} to set the tempo. The default scale is E-flat major (rooted at MIDI note 51), but you can change the scale by calling major(int), naturalMinor(int), harmonicMinor(int), or melodicMinor(int). The composer produces a Composition object as its product.

      Constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Composer

        public Composer()
        Constructor. Creates a new empty Composition, and sets the scale to E flat major rooted at E3.

    • Method Detail

      • pdur

        public void pdur(double beats)
        Set the duration of a percussive strike (created by the p(double) and p(double, int) methods. The default value is 0.25 (a quarter beat). Note that the percussion sounds in some soundfonts don't play correctly if the strike duration is too short.
        Parameters:
        beats - duration of percussive strikes, in beats

      • currentMeasure

        public int currentMeasure()
        Return the current measure.
        Returns:
        the current measure

      • instr

        public Instrument instr(int patch)
        Create a new MIDI instrument using the built-in "emergency" MIDI soundbank.
        Parameters:
        patch - the MIDI patch (starting from 1)
        Returns:
        the instrument

      • instr

        public Instrument instr(java.lang.String soundFont)
        Create a new MIDI instrument loaded from a specified soundfont file. The instrument will play using the default patch.
        Parameters:
        soundFont - the sound font file name
        Returns:
        the instrument

      • n

        public Chord n(int... notes)
        Create a note or notes chosen from the composer's Scale.
        Parameters:
        notes - the note(s), which should be in the range 0..6 for a normal heptatonic scale, but could be above or below that range to select notes in octaves above or below the scale's "normal" octave
        Returns:
        the Chord representing the note(s)

      • an

        public Chord an(int... pitches)
        Create a note or notes based on absolute MIDI pitch numbers. This is useful for notes captured from a live audition. It is also useful for playing notes that aren't part of the current scaoe.
        Parameters:
        pitches - one or more MIDI pitch numbers
        Returns:
        the Chord representing the notes

      • m

        public Melody m(java.lang.Object... chords)
        Create a melody consisting of the specified sequence of chords.
        Parameters:
        chords - the chords: can be integers (to select single notes), or Chord objects
        Returns:
        the melody

      • rm

        public Melody rm(Chord chord,
                 int n)
        Create a melody consisting of a specified number of repetitions of the given Chord.
        Parameters:
        chord - the Chord to repeat
        n - the number of times to repeat the chord
        Returns:
        the melody

      • gm

        public Melody gm(Melody... melodies)
        Combine several Melody objects into a single Melody. The chords of each melody are added to the result in order.
        Parameters:
        melodies - the Melody objects to combine
        Returns:
        the combined Melody

      • xn

        public Chord xn(int octave,
                Chord orig)
        Shift the octave of a note/chord.
        Parameters:
        octave - the octave: -1 for one octave down, 1 for one octave up, etc.
        orig - the original note/chord
        Returns:
        the shifted note/chord

        orig - the melody to shift
        Returns:

      • xf

        public Figure xf(int octave,
                 Figure orig)
        Shift the octave in the melody of a Figure.
        Parameters:

        orig - the figure whose melody should be shifted
        Returns:

      • s

        public Strike s(double beat,
                double duration,
                int velocity)
        Create a strike with a specified velocity. Higher velocity generally means a louder note/chord when played.
        Parameters:
        beat - offset in beats
        duration - duration in beats
        velocity - velocity, in the range 0..127
        Returns:
        the strike

        velocity - velocity, in the range 0..127

        public Rhythm r(Strike... strikes)
        Create a rhythm from a sequence of strikes.
        Parameters:
        strikes - sequence of strikes
        Returns:
        a rhythm

      • rr

        public Rhythm rr(Strike first,
                 double spacing,
                 int n)
        Create a repeated rhythm containing a specified number of percussive strikes.
        Parameters:
        first - the first strike: the other strikes will be identical except for their start time
        spacing - the amount of time between the strikes, counted in beats
        n - how many strikes to generate
        Returns:
        the rhythm

      • gr

        public Rhythm gr(Rhythm... rhythms)
        Create a rhythm by combining the strikes in one or more Rhythms.
        Parameters:
        rhythms - the rhythms to combine
        Returns:
        the single combined rhythm

      • sr

        public Rhythm sr(double shift,
                 Rhythm orig)
        Create a rhythm by shifting the start beat of all of the strikes in a given rhythm by a specified shift.
        Parameters:
        shift - the shift (amount to add to each start beat)
        orig - the original rhythm
        Returns:
        the shifted rhythm

      • f

        public Figure f(Rhythm rhythm,
                Melody melody,
                Instrument instrument)
        Create a figure from a Rhythm, Melody, and Instrument.
        Parameters:
        rhythm - the rhythm
        melody - the melody
        instrument - the instrument
        Returns:
        the figure

      • pf

        public Figure pf(Rhythm rhythm,
                 int note,
                 Instrument instrument)
        Create a "percussion figure", in which a rhythm specifies how to play a single percussion "note", which really designates a particular MIDI percussion instrument (using the MIDI percussion key map.) This method avoids the necessity of creating a Melody.
        Parameters:
        rhythm - the rhythm to play
        note - the note selecting the MIDI percussion instrument
        instrument - the instrument (which must have type InstrumentType.MIDI_PERCUSSION
        Returns:
        the percussion figure

      • add

        public Composer add(Figure figure)
        Add a figure to play in the current measure in the current Composition. The start times of the Strikes are checked to determine how many measures are being added (usually one, but it's definitely possible and useful to add longer figures that comprise multiple measures.)
        Parameters:
        figure - the figure to play
        Returns:
        this composer: allows calls to add to be chained

      • addn

        public Composer addn(int n,
                     Figure figure)
        Repeatedly call add(Figure) a specified number of times.
        Parameters:
        n - number of times to add the figure
        figure - the figure to add
        Returns:
        this composer: allows calls to be chained

      • addseq

        public Composer addseq(Figure... figures)
        Call the add(Figure) method on a series of figures. This will add them to the composition sequentially, starting at the current measure.
        Parameters:
        figures - the figures to play sequentially
        Returns:
        this composer: allows calls to be chained

      • addseqn

        public Composer addseqn(int n,
                        Figure... figures)
        Repeatedly call addseq(Figure...) a specified number of times.
        Parameters:
        n - number of times
        figures - the sequence of figures to repeatedly add
        Returns:
        this composer: allows calls to be chained

      • add1

        public Composer add1(Figure figure)
        Add a figure to the composition at the current measure, and advance by exactly one measure. This is useful if the figure plays for slightly longer than one measure, but we don't want to allow the "spillover" as being counted as a full second measure.
        Parameters:
        figure - the figure to play
        Returns:
        this composer: allows calls to add to be chained

      • add1n

        public Composer add1n(int n,
                      Figure figure)
        Repeatedly call add1n(int, Figure) a specified number of times.
        Parameters:
        n - number of times to add the figure
        figure - the figure to add
        Returns:
        this composer: allows calls to be chained

      • at

        public Composer at(int measure,
                   Figure figure)
        Add a figure to play at a specified measure, without changing the current measure. This is useful for scheduling a figure to play at an absolute position in the composition.
        Parameters:
        measure - the measure when the figures should play
        figure - the figure to play
        Returns:
        this composer: allows calls to add to be chained

      • audition

        public void audition(Instrument instr)
        Audition by playing specified instrument live, recording the midi events, and translating them into a rhythm, melody, and figure.
        Parameters:
        instr - the instrument to play live

      • v

        public void v(Instrument instr,
              double gain)
        Set the volume (gain) on given instrument, effective from the beginning of the composition.
        Parameters:
        instr - the instrument whose gain to set
        gain - the gain, between 0 (silent) and 1 (loudest)

      • v

        public void v(int measure,
              Instrument instr,
              double gain)
        Set the volume (gain) on given instrument, effective from the beginning of the specified measure.
        Parameters:
        measure - the measure when the volume change should take effect
        instr - the instrument whose gain to set
        gain - the gain, between 0 (silent) and 1 (loudest)

      • addfx

        public void addfx(Instrument instr,
                  AddEffect effect)
        Add an effect to the effects chain for given instrument.
        Parameters:
        instr - the instrument
        effect - the effect to add
